alert.note: Alert for Fall River; Southern Black Hills; Southern Foot Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 5:41PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Custer, western Fall River and southeastern Weston Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 541 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Morrisey to 6 miles southeast of Mule Creek Junction to 20 miles west of Montrose. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Dewey around 555 PM MDT. Burdock around 600 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Edgemont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Fall River; Southern Black Hills; Southern Foot Hills
